senses.sense_definition: To press ridges, pleats, or wavy patterns into fabric or lace, usually with heated tools.

examples.text: The seamstress used a special iron to <w>gauffer</w> the collar of the blouse.
It takes skill to <w>gauffer</w> delicate materials without burning them.

senses.sense_definition: To decorate the edges of a book's pages by impressing a pattern with heated tools.

examples.text: An expert binder can <w>gauffer</w> the gilt edges to create a beautiful design.
They chose to <w>gauffer</w> the pages to add an extra touch of luxury to the volume.
